Posts.Title: Hola i live in Spain and have previously been in touch with other...

Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne Sorry you are feeling so sore, I was told when I had my Operation on 11/3/14 to make sure I was not in pain after the operation.  I was taking paracetamol 1mg & iberbrofen 600, every 8 hours.  Have you checked with your CN who should help you to control the pain.  It is important for you to be PAIN FREE. Have a look at your scars, the sooner the better, they are probably not as bad as you thought, mine weren't. It does get better I promise.... been there got the t-shirt. I have been very fortunate that my friends here in Spain have been so supportive, my Husband has been marvellous.  I find it is great being a supervisor...he now knows how the washer & iron works.  It helps him to cope with what is happening to me. I can cope until I get the sympathy looks & "I am so sorry"  wow that really brings the tears.  Worse thing for me was when I had to tell my son who was serving in Afghanistan.  I saw his Facebook & he said of all the things he had had to endure hearing I had Breast Cancer was the worst day of his life. The Army sent him back early & I was able to see him the week after my op that was a great boost. I go to see Oncologist on Friday 25th to find out what Radiotherapy & Hormone Treatment.  Not looking forward to any of it but it has to be done to ensure I am Cancer free & able to lead a long & happy life. Keep your chin up you are not alone. Lots of love
Posts.Title: Feel a bit unimportant

Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne You need to step back & let others do things for you it is not easy but unless you take it easy you will not feel good about yourself.  Your body has been through a major trauma, is telling you to relax & let it heal. I am 6 weeks post lump op & only now feeling something like myself, for the moment, it feels good. I do know I have got to ask for help & stop trying to do everything myself. So what if the house need dusting, your health is more important. I am going on 5th May to get results of Genes Test to see what Hormone & radiotherapy I will need.  Not looking forward to this but I know this is something I need to do to get healthy again.  As I was told by a lovely friend, by letting someone help you, you are giving them the gift of allowing them to show their love & concern for you. You have never stopped being YOU this is just a glitch that will pass, do something nice for yourself, a new pair of shoes does it for me!!! Take care of yourself, get plenty of rest & do not overdo it. Lots of love Patxx
Posts.Title: When will I be "ME" again ???

Posts.Content: I live in Spain & found my BC because the lump was painful, mammogram just confirmed it was malignant. I needed a lumpectomy & some very skilled Surgeons saved my nipple. Have just completed 11 days of 21 Radiotherapy & will have 5 years on Letrozol.  Thankfully I did not need Chemo. I had a Mammaprint test on the tumour which individualised my treatment. I am coping very well with the Radiotherapy at the moment, not as bad as I thought it would be.  I have been prescribed different creams, one for the Radiotherapy & one for the redness & itching, both are working very well. All seems well except when I read the posts on this website & feel I have been extremely fortunate/lucky what ever the expression is.  I wonder why I have been so fortunate with treatment & results.  I know it is irrelevant & I should be thankful, which I am, just these stupid thoughts go through my head.  It was good to read I am not the only one. Thank you all Pat

Posts.Title: Blisters after Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: The info on the Bush Flower Essence - Electro essence says it Reduces emotional effect of Radiation. Greatly relieves emotional fear & distress associated with earth, electrical & electromagnetic radiation.  It helps to bring one into balance with the natural rhythms of the earth. I only know that I didn't get it until after my 2nd Rads, my head felt as if it was plugged into the electricity grid.  I took it as instructed from the 3 day which was a Saturday & by the Monday I felt fine.  I was not too tired & from what I have heard the burns are minimal.  Still not fun but bearable & treatable. Try the wet flannels in the fridge or gel packs 2 or 3 times a day, which also helped me & took the fire out of the burns. Hope this helps   Pat xx
Posts.Title: Blisters after Radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Like you I am very fair skinned a friend suggested  Australian Bush Flower Essence -Electro Essence. I do think it has helped, I got it from Amazon about £11 a bottle, I needed 2 bottles for 21 sessions. 7 drops under the tongue morning & evening.  Start 3 days before & I am continuing while I am having soreness & burns. Hope this helps, Love & careful Hugs Patxx

Posts.Title: bit worried

Posts.Content: I completed 21 Rads last Thursday. Can I suggest you use a wet flannel or gel pad cooled in the fridge every day. This cools the breast down & if you can go topless do that, as it gets air to your body.  Use the creams you have been prescribed at least 3 times a day & if you can't sleep because of discomfort Paracetamol or something similar. You will get various aches & pains, tell you Oncologist.  One is it feels as if someone is pressing on your breast bone!!! Hope this helps. Love & hugs Patxx
Posts.Title: It's my 1st review today ?

Posts.Content: This is Patricia 34  I live in Spain, Torrevieja. I will Friend you if you want to talk privately. I have completed my treatment Hurrah!!!   Having a few problems from the Radiotherapy&  got an infection, this is being dealt with.  Not having anyone to consult or compare with, I would have probably got help earlier.  It is important we have someone we can talk/email. There are 3 of us in the Torrevieja area & we have become friends.  We support & meet up with each other. It has made a big difference to me & I no longer feel alone.  We are all at different stages so can advise on what will happen with treatments. Thanks to all the people on the Macmillan site. Patx
